text: Judge Moorer will serve the Southern District with distinction. I was proud to support his confirmation today and to congratulate him personally for his historic appointment as the first African-American to hold this seat. https://t.co/xgepDcUbtK
Glad to be supporting @SenatorBaldwin’s bill and to continue the fight to protect people with pre-existing conditions. https://t.co/qEdafQSW0w

The Administration’s tariffs were going to cost jobs, not save them. The ITC made a crucial ruling today to protect our local newspapers and the communities that depend on them. Read my statement here: https://t.co/hYCf6sjFB9. https://t.co/L7mhhmOCwJ

Meet Regina Pruitt of Hoover, AL. Born w/Cystic Fibrosis, she must keep up w/a growing number of hospital trips & medical bills while living her daily life. She wanted to share her story about living w/CF & the high drug prices she pays, even w/insurance: https://t.co/3DwUd2aBOH https://t.co/SUKuNiRd05

1-in-3 Alabamians under 65 have a pre-existing condition. If this lawsuit succeeds, AL would be among the states most hurt. Oral arguments start today. Pay close attention—there's too much at stake to let us backslide to a time before these protections. https://t.co/PLHZUEu0XL
Telemedicine can be a lifeline for rural communities—efforts like these ensure Alabamians in every corner of our state get access to high-quality health care. #broadband https://t.co/P0ikFxM95D

Interested in attending a U.S. military service academy? My team is hosting informational sessions across Alabama next week to explain the process and answer your questions. Check out the schedule here: 
https://t.co/mV46XxFAp8

Alabama is a trade state & the modernization of our port is key to our future. I’m proud to join ⁦@SenShelby⁩ and my colleagues in fighting for AL farmers/businesses and supporting efforts to secure new opportunities brought by a wider, deeper port. https://t.co/76ODO4IZTm
https://t.co/PI17GGcdMc

REMINDER: Next week, my team will be hosting informational sessions across Alabama for anyone interested in attending a U.S. military service academy. For more information, please visit: https://t.co/Xglj39DLwE. https://t.co/ok5COxR0LK

.@AAPA_Seaports+@AAR_FreightRail leaders: "...policy emanating from DC—regardless of recent progress with Mexico—threatens Alabama's trade-dependent economy. Indeed, the macro-economic principle of free trade...remains under attack by select policymakers."
https://t.co/ZyoFpZWyqv

Jody has served @NASA for 3+ decades and has gained the skills needed to take @NASA_Marshall to the next level. Her appointment as the 1st woman in this position is historic & will be an inspiration to young women interested in STEM. My full statement: https://t.co/MfIkqL8EEO https://t.co/O6vdqp2yN8

We're fortunate to have Dr. @mattmight leading the way at @UABNews on #PrecisionMedicine. I've been so impressed by this cutting-edge initiative and I am very proud that it is based in the great state of Alabama! https://t.co/LiD5Es4eD0

Addie Mae. Carole. Cynthia. Carol Denise. Today, we remember these four bright little girls who were killed at the 16th St Baptist Church 55 years ago in a bombing perpetrated by the KKK. This case and these families will always hold a special meaning for me. https://t.co/4eeSvqUx41

This was a very brave step to come forward. It is more important than ever to hit the pause button on Kavanaugh’s confirmation vote until we can fully investigate these serious and disturbing allegations. We cannot rush to move forward under this cloud. https://t.co/SIHzdnnOFJ

TODAY: my team is hosting informational sessions in Selma and Montgomery for anyone interested in attending a U.S. military service academy. For more information, please visit: https://t.co/Xglj39DLwE https://t.co/qSaoVz0gEX

Alabama is home to 14 outstanding HBCUs – not just the most, but the best in the nation! Today I was honored to introduce legislation to increase funding for HBCUs and other minority-serving institutions. Hear more about my bill & why this is needed: https://t.co/PneGC1wG5x https://t.co/PaUtoHcvar
We need to have a full investigation of the allegations against Judge Kavanaugh— including the testimony of Mark Judge. If he won’t testify, he needs to be subpoenaed. https://t.co/6fXOkujRwY

TODAY: my team is hosting an informational session in Birmingham for anyone interested in attending a U.S. military service academy. For more information, please visit: https://t.co/Xglj39DLwE https://t.co/Ai2IkP4xNB
Wishing all those observing Yom Kippur a meaningful day of atonement and an easy fast.

TODAY: my team is hosting informational sessions in Huntsville and Dothan for anyone interested in attending a U.S. military service academy. For more information, please visit: https://t.co/Xglj39ma84 https://t.co/4rqf24zjEC

I’ve successfully prosecuted 38-year-old crimes. It wasn’t easy, but it was the right thing to do to get justice for the victims. 

All I‘m asking for is a full, fair investigation. Let’s get to the truth, whatever it may be.

We need to get this right. There’s too much at stake.

Thanks to everyone who came out to our military academy info session last night in Bham! Tonight my team will host sessions in Huntsville and Dothan. Come on out if you’re interested in attending one! https://t.co/d0T37iR9bv

Tomorrow, 9/21, my team will hold events in Bham & Mobile as a part of @bidencancer’s #BidenCancerSummit. These events have speakers Dr. @mattmight – a leader in precision medicine – @ the Bham event & state Senator Vivian Figures @ our Mobile summit. Hope y’all can make it! https://t.co/ZyUcIFpkfs

Had a great time at the #GulfCoastChallenge last night—congrats to A&M and Southern on a game well played! Fun way to celebrate top-notch HBCUs through Alabama’s favorite sport. https://t.co/g9heLRnHrK

Ann Johnson & her husband came to DC from Madison, AL and stopped by #DonutsWithDoug last week. Ann has polycystic kidney disease. Like the other 1.9M Alabamians w/pre-existing conditions, she is worried about her coverage. I'll continue to fight for Ann and others like her. https://t.co/nYmq0EhmdD

Fentanyl not only harms those who use it, but it also poses a serious threat to our first responders should they be exposed. This legislation is another smart step to stop illicit fentanyl from being transported across our borders and into our communities.
https://t.co/Nqo59lGaae
Happy #NationalVoterRegistrationDay! Every vote counts – Alabamians must register by October 22 to be eligible to vote on November 6: https://t.co/mT1Ufby3Bv
Birmingham's own @dolestermiles leads the cover of @gardenandgun this month with her famous sweet potato pie -- congrats! https://t.co/tQNynXuBad

5 years ago @senatorleahy & @mikecrapo led a bipartisan effort to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act. At the end of Sept, #VAWA expires. Let's stand w/ women across America by finally making this legislation *permanent* — we need it now more than ever.

So many remarkable song writers have been born out of the south & they deserve to have their hard work protected. I’m proud to have co-sponsored this legislation here in the Senate – congrats, @SenAlexander! https://t.co/6dzYNxkwNr

Today we took an important step for families of civil rights cold case victims–my bipartisan Civil Rights Cold Case Records Collection Act earned committee approval & is 1 step closer to becoming law. Let this be a reminder that justice delayed doesn't have to be justice denied. https://t.co/BEez48QWkf

The Kavanaugh nomination process has been flawed from the beginning and incomplete at the end. Dr. Ford was credible and courageous and I am concerned about the message our vote will be sending to our sons and daughters, as well as victims of sexual assault. I will be voting no.

Great news -- @fema is awarding over $18 million in federal funding to replace a @JSUNews building that was damaged in the severe storms this March. This covers 75% of the project’s cost and is a great step toward rebuilding the community.

REMINDER: today is the first day you can apply for federal financial aid for college or grad school. Many schools have different deadlines, so better to fill it out earlier rather than later! Learn more about #FAFSA here: https://t.co/E1kbMhPE6v. https://t.co/s0O6aHHfNF

REMINDER: you only have two more weeks to apply for a military academy nomination from me—the deadline is OCTOBER 15 at 5:00 p.m. CDT. Learn more about how to apply here: https://t.co/Xglj39DLwE https://t.co/8ST6aKsu8s

Thanks to @AL_DECE for stopping by today to talk about the importance of early childhood education and Alabama’s commitment to giving our youngest students a strong foundation for a bright future. Always great to hear more about the important work you do. https://t.co/cLAfPOZFXF

Started my day at the weekly Senate Prayer Breakfast - needed that! Then met w/ the AL Truckers Association who gave us great input on improving infrastructure in AL & across the country as well as ideas to increase training & jobs in their industry which is vital to our economy. https://t.co/cAQt7Pbebu

Well said, @SenSherrodBrown! I’m an original cosponsor on this bill and won’t rest on this vitally important issue – people with pre-existing conditions should be covered. Period. https://t.co/cC6vYOPG4k

When you pair education, infrastructure & rural health care, you create opportunity — the @cullmanchamber gets it. Thanks for being a strong partner to your community. It was great to see y’all in Washington today! https://t.co/mBaVbiA43q

Great news! The final #opioids bill passed today with support from 98 senators. This major bipartisan effort will:

✔️Improve federal response coordination
✔️Invest in non-opioid painkiller research
✔️Help stop flow of synthetic drugs into the US

#SUPPORTAct

Even on my busiest days, it always gets better when I meet with bright, ambitious kids from Alabama. The Mountain Brook Debate team came by today for a chat, asking great questions and engaging in a thoughtful conversation—something we could use more of in the Senate! https://t.co/obY18hK23P

HAPPENING NOW: I’m heading to the Senate floor to talk about the Supreme Court confirmation process and make a call for civility & unity. 

Watch here: https://t.co/29MPJmoKCP

This process has devolved into a partisan political battle. We need to take some time to reflect on what kind of Senate—and what kind of country—we want to be. For the good of our nation, it’s time to bridge the divide and work together.

REMINDER: you have one more week to apply for a military academy nomination from me—the deadline is OCTOBER 15 at 5:00 pm CDT. Learn more about how to apply here: https://t.co/Xglj39ma84 https://t.co/WhK5Lrl7Gm
Text “ALALERT” to 888777 to get updates from @AlabamaEMA about #HurricaneMichael. Stay safe, y’all! https://t.co/VTz0yAjS0O

Mental health is just as important as physical health. On this #WorldMentalHealthDay, let's commit to ending the stigma around treating mental illness. And if you ever need it, help is only a phone call away. https://t.co/TyxZ24EyTE

Thank you @LesterHoltNBC for highlighting the @MemPeaceJustice Museum and the lives that were senselessly taken during the darkest chapter of our nation’s history. These stories deserve to be told and need to be heard. Folks, if you haven’t visited the museum yet, please do. https://t.co/UmwNixdyVS
Please stay safe out there during #HurricaneMichael. Here are some key resources in case you need help. https://t.co/UWVSLC85xO

For any folks in SE Alabama impacted by #HurricaneMichael, you can reach out to my Dothan team to get assistance or information about recovery resources.

You can call 334-792-4924 or visit my office in the federal building (100 West Troy St, #302, Dothan AL).

As a result of #HurricaneMichael, I’ll be heading to Fort Rucker this afternoon to tour damage & get the latest info on storm impacts. Unfortunately, that means I will miss the Fortis graduation tonight in Mobile. My best to all of the graduates & I hope to make it back soon!

Happy #NationalFarmersDay to all of our farmers—and thank you! After #HurricaneMichael, we are all reminded about the hard work and risk our farmers face each season. My team and I stand ready to help our Alabama farmers impacted by the storm. https://t.co/BUAozqI8qu

Thanks to the team @ Ft. Rucker for the storm damage tour after #HurricaneMichael. Thankfully, the impact wasn't as significant as we feared, but concerns over crop damage linger. Optimistic for a full recovery bc of the great folks on the ground working around the clock. https://t.co/aq9UOAVGB4
Louise and me @talladegasuperS! Great to meet Alabamian @bubbawallace and take ride in the pace car — what a day!￼ https://t.co/cztz6dE0yC

REMINDER: TODAY is the deadline to apply for my military academy nominations! Be sure to send in your full application by 5:00 p.m. CDT. Learn more about how to apply here: https://t.co/Xglj39DLwE https://t.co/teH77QCi8B

Medicaid expansion in Alabama makes sense – for our economy, for our health, for our future. Thanks to retiring AL State Senator Gerald Dial for his common-sense, non-partisan approach to this topic. We should all be able to find common ground on this.
https://t.co/WYNLKvGOFK

Heartbreaking reporting from @whnt & @ChelseaBrentzel: Lawrence Co. resident Annie Hughes is “confident her bladder cancer is a result of years of drinking toxic water.”
 
Every Alabamian deserves access to clean water. It's time for the state and EPA to step up to address this. https://t.co/7oSP3xsAM6

Hurricane Michael didn’t just shut down power, but it significantly damaged our farms—particularly cotton crops. With $100M+ lost in cotton so far, I wrote to @SecretarySonny in support of Gov Ivey’s request to declare an agricultural disaster: https://t.co/IckY2GPK0A https://t.co/a5jMaOaew6

Alabama is the second-largest catfish producer in the nation, making this industry a vital part of our state economy. I’m proud to join @SenShelby to protect our catfish farmers and their vital contribution to Alabama. https://t.co/vzBM77IdlC

With the Rx drug abuse crisis plaguing so many families & communities, it’s also important to make sure these drugs don’t fall into the wrong hands. This Saturday, you'll be able to safely dispose of unused/expired Rx drugs. For a location near you, check: https://t.co/Fui32NvOgQ https://t.co/u3EP8nvahd

We’ve got to dial back the dangerous rhetoric and start injecting civility and respect in our dialogues. 

We’ve got to demand more of our leaders so we can progress together—not separately.

My full interview with @jaketapper here: https://t.co/L5lD9Oam95 https://t.co/v5rdMGzaqg
Starting off my day with Birmingham Mountain Radio to talk about the latest news and how we can start to unite and tone down the divisive rhetoric—listen here: https://t.co/t79IYxnZpQ

A big thanks to the Rotary Club of Shades Valley for inviting me to stop by yesterday — great to talk with y’all about the ways we can work together to build a stronger Alabama, from health care to jobs to education. https://t.co/pk6lQoUUAz

After a disaster like Hurricane Michael, the best way to help folks recover is to 1st listen to what they need. Had a great chat in Headland this am w/local farmers & @AlaAgriculture about how best to rebuild after devastating crop loss & how to protect our farmers going forward. https://t.co/IzoO5gVWRY

Open enrollment for health insurance plans begins TOMORROW and goes until December 15, 2018. For more information on how to set up or change your 2019 coverage, visit: https://t.co/plHXKN2mV1 https://t.co/228cdmb9uf
November is Military Family Appreciation Month! We thank and honor our service members and their families for their shared commitment and sacrifices they make on our behalf. https://t.co/K1wybPZEZn
Crossing ‘party’ lines to be an @AuburnU Tiger today! #WarEagle https://t.co/5qL7Mdi5Bc

Josh Hillman has a bright future ahead of him, but the Republican lawsuit to repeal health reforms protecting pre-existing conditions could sidetrack his path to success.

https://t.co/1Ky9jBA5r6

Alabamians are resilient, but many still need assistance to fully recover from #HurricaneMichael. I've asked the President to approve additional grants so that more folks can get back on their feet. Read my full letter here: https://t.co/rObyWWejMl

What an honor to congratulate Col. (Ret.) Galen Rosher & others for their inductions into the Hall of Heroes tonight! Col. Rosher had a remarkable military career leading the charge for a new era in aviation. Watch @waff48’s piece on him to learn more: https://t.co/ZQsUl0F96G https://t.co/57beKAXgSB
On #VeteransDay—and every day—we honor all those who have served our nation with dedication and love of country. https://t.co/xF9aPTYnSd
To all of our fantastic educators across Alabama, happy #NationalEducationWeek! Your commitment to our next generation is nothing short of inspiring—thank you for all you do! https://t.co/Fl5MpSHx3e

As an avid outdoorsman & hunter, I'm troubled by the spread of Chronic Wasting Disease & its impact on wildlife in Alabama. We need to help give wildlife officials the tools they need to contain its spread. Read more on my bipartisan proposal here: https://t.co/pKh1SGbzEp”

Welcome to #SweetHomeAlabama, @MazdaUSA + @toyota! We’re thrilled you chose the Yellowhammer State for your new manufacturing facility and it is a true testament to the phenomenal workforce we have in our great state. Let’s get started! https://t.co/IpQPxbTUhQ

Together, we are building a brighter future for the region and for Alabama – a future for our children and grandchildren. I stand with you as a strong partner in these efforts to expand opportunity and grow our economy.” @MazdaUSA @ToyotaUSA https://t.co/REYpd2bwmO

Sam Butler is a fifth-generation soybean farmer and showed me around his New Hope farm today — we discussed the importance of protecting our growers from the impacts of the Admin’s tariffs. https://t.co/fPKwTNB3d0
